Description: A hollow terracotta figure of a Sothic dog, modelled in the round, standing to right with its head turned to front. Its tail is curled forward, and it wears a collar with a small circular pendant, a bulla. The hair is detailed at rear, but the collar is not indicated. Two-piece mould. Buff marl clay, covered with a yellow-brown slip.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. 'Probably from the Fayum' written on stand. Roman, first or second century AD. Comparanda: Close: Fischer 1994: no. 1120, dated Hellenistic period (?) = Vogt 1924: pl. cvi:8. Near: Bayer-Niemeier 1988: no. 642, dated about ad 200; Hilton Price 1897: 396, no. 3288, from the Fayum; Szyma´nska 1999c: 82, fig. 9, from Edfu. Bibliog: Fischer 1994: 418, no. 1121.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3708)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
